author: Joshua Fluke
description:
Check out the Viaim Open note Earbuds here:  http://bit.ly/473wiln 
Use my code Joshua for 10% off!

When companies say “we appreciate you,” what they really mean is “we bought two pizzas and some glitter glue.”

From pizza parties to “lemonade in a cubicle” and mascots that look like they escaped a children’s TV show, corporate employee appreciation has officially hit rock bottom. This video dives into the most painfully awkward ways companies pretend to care — complete with playground field trips, fake smiles, and LinkedIn hashtags no one asked for.

Because nothing says “we value your contribution” like making you hug a guy in a sea-otter costume before clocking out early to cry in your car.

Watch till the end for the most cringe-inducing appreciation posts ever uploaded to LinkedIn.
#CorporateCringe #EmployeeAppreciation #PizzaPartyCulture
title: EMPLOYEE APPRECIATION IS DEAD
